channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Woman on flight with Covid-19 case contacted by tracing team 4.5 weeks later
item.description: Four-and-a-half weeks after a woman came into contact with a confirmed Covid-19 case, she was finally contacted by the Ministry of Health's tracing team.

item.title: Transmission Gully hits new delays with completion date uncertain
item.description: Work on Wellington's billion dollar Transmission Gully project has been drastically curtailed as the completion date is delayed again.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 4 May
item.description: Russia's coronavirus cases rose by more than 10,000 in the highest daily increase since the outbreak began in the country.

item.title: Covid-19: Southern DHB releases worst-case scenario modelling
item.description: Intensive care units at Dunedin and Invercargill hospitals would have been overwhelmed before the end of this month if the worst-case scenario for Covid-19 had played out.

item.title: Hospitals urged to consider putting off some surgery
item.description: Hospitals are being told to consider putting off surgery for seriously overweight people and those over 70 unless it is urgent.

item.title: Covid-19: what happened in NZ on 3 May
item.description: On a day which added just two cases to the country's Covid-19 total, the government said it has approved the fast tracking of large shovel ready projects, largely bypassing the RMA.

item.title: SPCA urges struggling pet owners to seek help
item.description: Kittens that were just five or six weeks old have died, been stuffed in a bread bag and dumped by the side of the road, an SPCA report says.

item.title: New Zealanders still stuck abroad hope for extra repatriation flights
item.description: New Zealanders left behind in India are asking for more repatriation flights, after the government did not have enough capacity to evacuate everyone who wanted to come home.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 and no deaths
item.description: The Ministry of Health has announced two new cases of Covid-19, no new probable cases, and no deaths today.

item.title: Heavy rain hits Auckland; SH6 near Westport reopens
item.description: Heavy rain, lightning and strong winds have whipped across many regions of the North Island this afternoon, but emergency services say the bad weather has caused few problems so far.

item.title: Caution advised after calls to release Health and Disability System Review
item.description: The Medical Association has called for the Health and Disability System Review's immediate release - but opposition to that says it would be ill considered.

item.title: Thieves target Horowhenua community club rooms
item.description: Thieves have targeted community club rooms in the Horowhenua town of Foxton Beach during lockdown.

item.title: Complex sewerage pipe work to begin next week
item.description: The long-awaited repairs to broken sewer pipes in Wellington are being described as "incredibly technically challenging work" that has never been done before in Australasia.

item.title: Police warn parties could 'waste sacrifices' of lockdown
item.description: Police are sending a blunt message to people who have chosen to break their bubbles over the weekend - no parties, no excuses.

item.title: More support needed for the elderly even outside lockdowns
item.description: Vulnerable older people will still need help, even after the covid-19 pandemic is over, community organisations say.

item.title: Kiwi aid worker in Bangladesh says next few weeks critical
item.description: A New Zealand aid worker based in the world's largest refugee camp is bracing for coronavirus to sweep through the settlement as the government is urged to step up its humanitarian response.

item.title: Spike in racism during pandemic, Human Rights Commission reports
item.description: As New Zealand makes strong progress in eliminating Covid-19, there are also calls to "flatten the racism curve".

item.title: Cabinet approves fast tracking of shovel ready projects
item.description: Cabinet has approved the fast tracking of large shovel ready projects, largely bypassing the Resource Management Act.
